Text.Value: We're avoiding the whole area. I won't lose one more beak to the blighter.
Your reconnaissance is appreciated. This information will be vital in deciding our new strategy. Dismissed!
You've got a pretty  high opinion of yourself, for a pigeon.
Leave me be, ground-walker. I've reports to prepare.
Are you Squee?
Leave.
Against the Absolute? I know, I'm fighting in it.
*The bird coos its approval.*
Why does a flock of carrier pigeons need a commander?
Not your fault you fell for it. You need a strong leader like myself to see the wood under the trees.
Why does a flock of carrier pigeons need a commander?
Leave.
None of that changes the fact you're only a pigeon.
Stroke the pigeon's head.
The army? Those great, clodding dirt snufflers.
Because! We deliver communications across dangerous enemy territory, with only our superior wits and aerial agility to protect us.
Leave.
Letters? Ah, you mean the top secret communiqués attached by the tall one.
Make your report. How did the battle unfold?
If you go that way, watch for the bell tower. That's the enemy's observation post.
*The pigeon avoids your outstretched hand. It glares at you.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The player reaches out a hand. The sound of flapping wings to imply the pigeon moved, the pigeon isn't impressed
[KC] Focus on reaction of pigeon with no player action to lower fidelity

Text.Value: If you pass that way, beware the sign of the featherless wings. From that rooftop, none return.
War's a vile business. But, we fight on! We must deliver!
Er, Lieutenant [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], reporting for duty.
I am Commander Lightfeather, leader of the finest aerial communication regiment this side of the Chionthar.
Do you know how many of us have passed on to the great nest in the sky in service to your kind?
It used to make a bloody awful racket, but it's fallen silent. No doubt our enemy has claimed the territory.
Squee? SQUEE? I am Commander Lightfeather and you will address me as such.

EditorData.NodeContext: Outraged, as though yelling at a subordinate

Text.Value: The insubordination...
*Coo.*
Show your palms to the bird.
*Your threats have no effect. This is an unflappable pigeon.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Pigeon doesn't react

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Text.Value: *The bird coos its approval. Yet you notice it flinched at the sight of your hand.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Player snaps a smart salute. 

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Text.Value: Your pigeons were eaten by a flying cat.
Ah. I'm afraid my tressym is the enemy responsible.
Shake your fist at the bird.
'Rank'? Are you in the army?
I found letters carried by some of your birds. I'm afraid they didn't make it.
You'll want to watch out for the enemy's observation post of course. Tallest point around these parts.
Let's see how tough you are after a taste of real warfare.
A flying cat? Is your brain completely addled?
A tressym? What nonsense is this? Making up words like a nincompoop.

EditorData.NodeContext: Like this is the most insane thing he's ever heard

Text.Value: Where did you say your enemy was located?
You have my thanks. Your service will not be forgotten.

EditorData.logicalname: SwA Hasmet, Kind fate for pigeons

Text.Value: I'm looking for some letters that weren't delivered. Any idea where I can find them?
I'm putting you on leave until you regain your senses. Dismissed!
The Absolute? Poppycock! Enemy propaganda designed to confuse simple minds.

EditorData.NodeContext: This is the most ridiculous thing he's ever heard

Text.Value: It sounds like you've quite the fight on your hands. Or, feathers?
[GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], man-at-arms, free agent. Reporting for duty, SIR!
[GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], woman-at-arms, free agent. Reporting for duty, SIR!
[GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], travelling blade, free agent. Reporting for duty, SIR!
Er, Lieutenant [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], reporting for duty.
*With the offending articles out of sight, the bird is back at ease. No harm done.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Player puts their hands behind their back

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Text.Value: Go on, get out. Before I have you court martialled!

EditorData.logicalname: SwA Hasmet, Horible fate for pigeons

Text.Value: Our headquarters are for serving fliers only. You. Arre. Dismissed!
Salute the pigeon.
'Rank'? Are you in the army?
They died horrible, painful deaths. Blood, guts and feathers all over the place.
I'm hailed as [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53],  ex-overseer of the Cult of Bhaal. Currently on medical leave.
A PIGEON? We are WARRIORS, risking life and feather to deliver vital communiqués on a daily basis.
*The bird stares, eyes filled with fury. Perhaps your open hands are a symbol the bird has learned to hate.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Player shows their hands to the pigeon (calming gesture, palms out, hands fairly close together - similar to the open-hand temple's sigil). Pigeon flaps/is angry

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Text.Value: Of course they did! No doubt it was my training gave them the discipline and resolve to stay in the fight!
Bow to the pigeon.
They were eaten by a flying cat.
Damned awful business - fine fliers the lot of them, gone without a trace.
Stroke the pigeon's head.
Fly west of here, to the rooftop of the featherless wings. Face our enemy. Then call me pigeon. Pah!
I'm hailed as [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53],  ex-overseer of the Cult of Bhaal. Currently on medical leave.
Salute the pigeon.
The rooftop west of here. Look out for the observation tower - tallest thing around these parts.
*Coo.*
If they didn't arrive, no doubt they were attached to one of our recent casualties.
Intelligence is in short supply, but we know our enemy's flanked us on the west side, not one rooftop away.
State your purpose, ground-walker. I don't have all day.
Even our skills have their limits. We've lost several experienced fliers recently. They knew the risks, but still - damned shame!
I found your pigeons. What was left of them, anyway. There was so much blood...
You've got a pretty  high opinion of yourself, for a pigeon.
*Coo!*
Name and rank? Quickly now - there's a war on.
*Coo.*
I suspected as much. Bloody shame, but that's the nature of war.
*Coo.*
Leave.
And you dare show your face to me? Have you no honour? No respect for the dead?
Don't make me repeat myself. Name and rank.
Leave.
I hear some of your, er, officers have gone missing recently. What happened to them?
Get out! Never darken the doors of my coop again!
As for you, flightless one - it was an honour taking you under my wing. Dismissed!
Hide your hands behind your back.
I found the enemy you're talking about. Your pigeons fought bravely against it.
I found letters carried by some of your birds. I'm afraid they didn't make it.
Is there any more intelligence available for this mission?
They fought to the last feather against a truly formidable foe.
Bow to the pigeon.
*You bow low and graciously, but the pigeon has no appreciation for your courtesy.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Player performs a sweeping bow. Pigeon idling

[KC] Re-use bow contruction or focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Text.Value: *Coo!*
*The pigeon carries itself with an air of dignity, its mannerisms stern and commanding.*
At ease, at ease.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The player salutes

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Text.Value: Sorry Commander. I'll return to my mission.
You've returned. Yet my fliers have not. I suppose they've flown this mortal coop, so to speak.

EditorData.NodeContext: Officious, netural tone (pigeon could be annoyed at you, or not, at this point)
EditorData.logicalname: SwA Hasmet, Quest given, Found Tressym Nest

Synopsis: Players can use Speak with Animals to talk to the pigeon at the Post house to find out more information regarding the missing letters. The pigeon will point the player towards the Open Hand Temple roof.
